page.title: 06SCHOOLDAYS RELIVED 1915/23
page.content: I attended the old stone-built parochial school which was erected in 1865.It was used until 1964 and is now a Youth Club.The only houses in sight, when I started school in 1915 were the old rectory,the Almshouses in Church Lane and the schoolhouse,adjacent to the school, which was the home of the headmaster,Mr.J.Watson, and his wife. We had a variety of playground games including hopscotch, whip and top, shuttlecock and battledore and pingball. There was a maypole in the girls' playground. At that time it was a Church of England school.The rector used to give us religious instruction and an inspector came regularly. The lady of the manor would come occasionally to visit us and award prizes. If we met her outside school we were expected to curtsey.
